articleContent.title: Chord: add4 in C (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: add4 in C (Shape: E)

## Brief Description:
The add4 chord in the key of C adds the 4th note of the C major scale (F) to create an interesting and colorful sound. In the shape of E, this chord voicing blends well with other chords in the key of C major.

## Notes and Intervals:
- E (1st)
- G# (3rd)
- B (5th)
- F (4th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
The add4 chord in C (Shape: E) is commonly used in pop, rock, and contemporary music genres. It adds a dreamy and ethereal quality to the chord progression, creating a sense of tension and release. This chord can be used to provide a unique and atmospheric texture to a musical arrangement.

## Songs:
Here are three songs that use the add4 chord in C (Shape: E) in their chord progressions:
1. "Wonderwall" by Oasis
2. "Yellow" by Coldplay
3. "Blackbird" by The Beatles
